EncryptionType.Description: The encryption type to use. The only valid value is KMS.

KeyId.Description: The GUID for the customer-managed AWS KMS key to use for encryption. This value can be a globally unique identifier, a fully specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to either an alias or a key, or an alias name prefixed by "alias/".You can also use a master key owned by Kinesis Data Streams by specifying the alias aws/kinesis.

Key.Description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Value.Description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 255 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Arn.Description: The Amazon resource name (ARN) of the Kinesis stream

Name.Description: The name of the Kinesis stream.

RetentionPeriodHours.Description: The number of hours for the data records that are stored in shards to remain accessible.

ShardCount.Description: The number of shards that the stream uses. Required when StreamMode = PROVISIONED is passed.

StreamEncryption.Description: When specified, enables or updates server-side encryption using an AWS KMS key for a specified stream.

StreamModeDetails.Description: The mode in which the stream is running.

Tags.Description: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) to associate with the Kinesis stream.
